p: Being stationary autotrophs, plants need to overcome a variety of challenges such as herbivores, pathogens, and the need for a steady flow of nutrients despite the environmental changes. In order to cope with the various stresses and damages induced by a dynamic environment, plants have evolved to synthesize secondary metabolites that allow them to interact with their environment [ 1, 2]. These low-molecular-weight substances, which can be species- or genera-specific [ 2], represent a huge and heterogeneous group of bioactive compounds, used as high-value chemicals [ 3].
